Congratulations on making it to this stage of the evaluation. You are obviously very talented as very few people make it to this phase. As we’ve stated earlier, the companies we represent receive 100s of resumes for any given role and it is through these difficult assignments where you can differentiate yourself and be noticed. After completion of this final ‘real scenario’ assignment - there will be a quick technical interview on your delivery then you are ready to be hired.


The project is scoped to be simple and reasonable in size to enable you to demonstrate your enterprise-class skills. Though this is a fictitious example, this scenario is very similar to what you may encounter in your job.

Instructions

  • Try to complete as much as possible within given time-frame, even if you do not finish the assignment, your work will be evaluated depending on what and how much you completed.

  • Please note that you are expected to work on the assignment independently. Discussing assignment details with colleagues or any indication of outside help will be considered cheating.

  • Please do not expect hand-holding as this is an evaluation assignment.

  • Read the complete assignment before you start. Understand clearly what is required so your work will be easier and will meet our expectations.

Part 1: Manual Testing

Preconditions

  1. You must work on local machine to access the application under test (OrangeHRM).

  2. You can use any one browser to access the application such as IE V9 or above OR Chrome OR Firefox OR Safari browser for assignment to work.

  3. You may use Wink or any similar tool e.g. Screencast-o-matic for the demo of detected defects\odd behaviors.

  4. You may use any document or spreadsheet application for Test Cases, Test execution evidences, defects\odd behaviors documentation.


How to access the application:

You should be able to access OrangeHRM application from below link and credential:

http://opensource.demo.orangehrmlive.com/



User Name: Admin

Password: admin


Part 1 Objective

Create and execute the test cases for HRM application as follows:

  1. For the following scenario, create end-to-end tests for the functional flow for:

    1. create a new employee profile

    2. create its login credentials

    3. perform validations for the newly created OrangeHRM employee account.

  2. In the PIM module of HRM application (available after login), create custom fields for the additional information about an employee, it's usage and related verification.


NOTE:

  • Prepare the test data and include it wherever required in the test cases.

  • Mention the test data in the test cases preconditions whenever applicable.


Deliverables from this part

  • A document (.pdf, .txt, .docx, .xlsx, .md) named Scenarios_TestCases containing your Test Scenarios and Test Cases.

  • A document named TestExecution_Evidences containing the test execution report with summary, evidence of the test execution including test steps and concerned snapshots.

  • A document named Defects_Behaviours doc file containing details of the defects\odd behaviors observed.

  • A directory named Demo_ManualTesting and keep the recording of Wink for the demo of each found defects\behavior detected.


Part 2: Test Automation

Preconditions

  1. You must work on local machine.


Software Requirements


  • Candidate must use eclipse in order to create java project using selenium webdriver. Also install required plugins, utilities and frameworks to achieve the assignment goal.

  • You shall use Wink or any similar tool e.g. Screencast-o-matic for the demo of the ATCs complete execution\run.



Part 2 Objective

Create the Automated test cases (ATCs) for the specified Manual test cases (TCMs) and Execute them.

  • Create a selenium project called WorldBankData with Java programming and JUnit or TestNG framework.

  • You should automate the below TCMs.

    Sr. No. Test Step Expected Result
     1Open the world bank site in a firefox browser. 
    www.worldbank.org    		World bank site home page should open.
     2Click on the Data tab.It should navigate to World bank site Data tab.
     3Click on the link "visit the old site here" to navigate to older site.
    (Note - Above step added due to recent modification to the world bank website)
    Click on the "By Country" option below the label "Data".    		It should navigate to "http://archive.data.worldbank.org/" page
    (Note - Above step added due to recent modification to the world bank website)
    It should navigate to World bank site "Data" tab "Countries and Economies" section i.e. country page.     
     4In the Countries and Economies" section, in the "Income Levels" block,  click on "High income" item.It should navigate to World bank site's income-level/HIC page. 
     5Click on Country Andorra.It should navigate to Andorra country specific page.
     6Note the value for following 3 factors:
    "GDP at market prices (current US$)"
    "Population, total"
    "CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)"
    		The required data should get noted for the specific country.
     7Navigate back to World bank site's income-level/HIC page.It should navigate to World bank site's income-level/HIC page.
     8Read and note the data as in step 6 for each country.The required data should get noted for all the countries.
     9Click on Home tab of the country page.World bank site home page should open. 
     10Close the browser.Browser should get closed. 
     11Process the data programmatically and log the names of  top 3 countries along with their "GDP at market prices (current US$)" value.It should log the names of top 3 countries as per their "GDP at market prices (current US$)" value to the test log.
     12Process the data programmatically and log the names of  top 3 countries along with their Population, total" value.It should log the names of top 3 countries as per their "Population, total" value to the test log.
     13Process the data programmatically and log the names of  top 3 countries along with their "CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)" value.It should log the names of top 3 countries as per their "CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)" value to the test log. 
     14Export the all country data for all the 3 factors in the csv format at appropriate location in the Project directory.   It should export the specified data in the csv format at appropriate location in the Project directory. 

  • Before you implement the tests in to ATC, execute it manually and based on it create the appropriate test data to be used in the selenium automation project.

  • Just the test steps running is not enough, You should take care of various automation aspects while completing this project.

  • You should create scripts to automate steps and validations when necessary.

  • Do not make any dependency of your project to use any build tool such as Maven, Jenkins etc

  • Implement the cross-browser compatibility of your script with Internet Explorer and include the details of it in the readme file.

Finally after implementation and a final successful run\execution of ATCs, remove trial\scrap logs just keep the final one with successful run and also remove the test data added in the previous ATC executions using cleanup script. Create and include this cleanup script in the same selenium project itself.


Deliverables from this part

  • The complete Selenium project directory named WorldBankData with the only final test log (remove previous logs if any).

  • Create a Wink or any similar tool (e.g. Screencast-o-matic) recording that will give the demo of the project overview of what various items you developed during the implementation and the ATCs complete execution\run. Keep this recording in a folder named Demo_TestAutomation.

  • Include details in the readme file about what various setup you installed and what various settings you did to run the project successfully.

To be evaluated

  • The quality of your output (work)

  • Completeness in each part of the assignment

  • The documentation

Assignment Final Delivery / What to submit

Please, read and follow this section carefully. Any delivery that does not follow this section will score much less or simply won't be evaluated.

Follow the Solution Delivery Instructions described as follows which should consist of:

Archive named <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip containing the following:

README.txt file containing

  1. The summary of your work done (Both Part1 and Part2).

  2. The information on the setup and execution of your selenium test with also including list of all referenced jar files and dependencies for execution (Part2 details) and

  3. Your feedback about the assignment.

Part 1 directory containing

  1. Scenarios_TestCases document\spreadsheet containing the scenario-wise test cases.

  2. TestExecution_Evidences document\spreadsheet file containing evidences that the test cases were executed.

  3. Defects_Behaviors document\spreadsheet file containing detailed description of the defects or odd behaviors detected.

  4. Demo_ManualTesting directory containing recording of defects or odd behaviors.

Part 2 directory containing

  1. Selenium Project Directory named WorldBankData.

  2. Directory named Demo_TestAutomation containing recording of complete test Run\Execution.

So the resulting structure of your solution delivery should be:

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ README.txt

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ Part1

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ Part1 \ Scenarios_TestCases

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ Part1 \ TestExecution_Evidences

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ Part1 \ Defects_Behaviours

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ Part1 \ Demo_ManualTesting

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ Part2

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ Part2 \ WorldBankData

  • <FirstName_LastName - QA Engineer>.zip \ Part2 \ Demo_TestAutomation
